column4: i got a problem with my ubuntu 10.04....everytime i watch youtube it freezes for about less than 2mins just the video but the sound still works.....and i can't click anything when it happens any solution for this?
i got adobe flash installed already sir
Sure you do , dump that and use html5 instead then see if the issue present
am not a sir , please stop calling me that :) .. sure which browser you're using.
i use Chromuim and i don't have to install any extension for html5 to stream videos in youtube.
I should've post the link earliar.
remove the adobe flash player plugin first , then see if it streams with html5.
can u give me the command for it in terminal? pls? thanx
depends , how you got it installed in the first place .. as i recall there are two packages to install the adobe flash
check with apt-cache policy adobe-flashplugin .. if its this package then sudo apt-get remove --purge adobe-flashplugin .
Excuse me , my lap froze .. i guess X crached.
so apt-cahce showed that package is not installed , you need to remove purge the other one which i can't remember its name .
lemme check the correct name for it.
my last post was for you.
ah , the other package is flashplugin-installer .
